q8388415.brero_massimiliano.PTNetEditor.views.desktop

Class PTNDesktop

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLayeredPane
            • q8388415.brero_massimiliano.PTNetEditor.views.desktop.PTNDesktop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class PTNDesktop
extends javax.swing.JLayeredPane
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    When we set up the desktop we'll translate our net structure into node views. 1. We will draw our arcs direct from our net model. 2. This is also done by calling reset() and init() whenever a file has been parsed. Every node model type (place, transition) will have its own view representation in an own list for the node views. This way we may have to update nodes in the view list and in our net model but we separate views and model tier completely The synchronisation of models and views is is done by the PTNNetController. You find also the logic for adding and removing nodes there. The computations for moving nodes or drawing arcs will be taken care of by the PTNDesktopController Protocol: If the node and arc list are to be used in another thread (like net or desktop controller) a monitor must be put on those lists.
    Author:
    8388415 - Massimiliano Brero
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PTNDesktop

        public PTNDesktop(PTNAppController appController,
          PTNNet net)
        Basic operations will be put in the controller, like initializing attributes for buffered painting. Adds needed listeners to Controllers to identify desktop events.
        Parameters:
        appController - PTNAppController
        net - PTNNet The net model is just needed pass it to the instantiated controllers. The desktop will not communicate directly with the models.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Set up the desktop and calls the set-up operations on the net controller. This method will be called when starting the app or whenever a new file has been parsed.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Deletes node and arc view lists and sets size to default values. This method will be called whenever the desktiop is cleared or a pnml file has been parsed.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(java.awt.Dimension size)
        The method setSize is overridden because we want to be sure that all our nodes fit on the desktop. So we add the biggest current node size to the size given (+ a little fixed additional space).
        Overrides:
        setSize in class java.awt.Component

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Computes the maximum size this pane had so we can adjust the ScrollPanes' handles. This method will also redraw the arcs on the desktop and therefore will do that in an arc synchronized block.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • paintImmediately

        public void paintImmediately(java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        We use JComponent.paintImmediately(int, int, int, int) whenever something has to be drawn faster than maybe the Swing Event-Queue would allow. An Example: Drawing an new arc by using mouse dragging.
        Overrides:
        paintImmediately in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        bounds - Rectangle The area we want to synchronize. We will always repaint the complete desktop dince we do not have too much objects and those we have are not to complicated to draw.

      • drawArcs

        public void drawArcs(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws all arcs currently in arcs hashTable. There'a monitor on arcs just in case another thread (like in desktop controller) is manipulating the list while this method is called at the same time.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics

      • updateArcs

        public void updateArcs(java.lang.String id,
              java.awt.Point start,
              java.awt.Point end)
        Draws an arc and adds it to arc view list if it's a new one that was just painted. by the user.
        Parameters:
        id - The new arc's id.
        start - Point
        end - Point

      • updateArcs

        public void updateArcs(ArcView arcView)
        Overloads updateArcs(java.lang.String, java.awt.Point, java.awt.Point)(String id, Point start, Point end) so methods can also directly use arc view objects.
        Parameters:
        arcView - ArcView Methods gets information directly from a freshly created arc view object.

      • removeArc

        public void removeArc(java.lang.String id)
        If id is "newArc" an arc with a non valid target will be deleted. "newArc" is a kind of temporary id given by the controller to identify easily arcs that are not yet in the desktops arc list.
        Parameters:
        id - String

      • getNodeViews

        public java.util.ArrayList<NodeView> getNodeViews()

      • getArcViews

        public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,ArcView> getArcViews()
        Getter.
        Returns:
        Hashtable All Arcs currently visible on desktop.

      • addListenertoNode

        public void addListenertoNode(NodeView nodeView)
        This method allows us to create new nodes in other classes. The PTNDesktopController will be called everytime a node i dragged or an arc has to be drawn.
        Parameters:
        nodeView - NodeView

      • hasSelectedNodes

        public boolean hasSelectedNodes()
        Returns whether we have some selected nodes or none. So we may move or delete them at once.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • hasSelectedArcs

        public boolean hasSelectedArcs()
        Returns whether we have some selected arcs or none. So we may move or delete them at once.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • deselectNodes

        public void deselectNodes()
        Removes selection from previously selected nodes.

      • deselectArcs

        public void deselectArcs()
        Removes selection from previously selected arcs.

      • deleteSelectedNodes

        public void deleteSelectedNodes()
        Removes selected nodes and the connected arcs. Calls controller method PTNNetController.removeNodeAndArcs(q8388415.brero_massimiliano.PTNetEditor.views.NodeView) to erase their models too and update the net.

      • deleteSelectedArcs

        public void deleteSelectedArcs()
        Removes selected arcs and tells the controller to erase their models too and update the net.

      • redrawArcs

        public void redrawArcs(NodeView source)
        Stub for redrawing all incoming and outgoing arcs for a node that has been moved.
        Parameters:
        source - NodeView

      • addNewArc

        public void addNewArc(NodeView source,
             NodeView target)
        This method works as connection between desktopController which handles the drawing event and netController which does the net building work after user wants to add a new arc. It will then repaint the desktop and update the complete net view. This method would then - in a next development stage - show briefly a label that informs the user that an arc was successfully added to the net.
        Parameters:
        source - NodeView
        target - NodeView

      • callNodeAttributeDialog

        public void callNodeAttributeDialog(NodeView source)
        Each dialog has its own corresponding window. Since this windows shall be modal we will call them from our desktop instead of simply calling them from the controller.
        Parameters:
        source - NodeView Node whose attributes have to be changed.

      • callNewNodeDialog

        public void callNewNodeDialog(java.awt.Point nodeLocation)
        Dialog window when a new node shall be added.
        Parameters:
        nodeLocation -

      • callResizeDesktopDialog

        public void callResizeDesktopDialog()
        Dialog window requesting the width an height of the enlarged desktop.

      • callDeleteArcsDialog

        public void callDeleteArcsDialog(NodeView sourceView)
        Stars Dialog for deleting Arcs. Since we want to delete them both from our view and from the net model, we will pass them to the controller and let him do the job.
        Parameters:
        sourceView - NodeView

      • getNodeViewById

        public NodeView getNodeViewById(java.lang.String id)
        Getter
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the node this method shall look up.
        Returns:
        NodeView Corresponding Node if an node with that id exists in the desktop's node list. Null if it does not (Even though NULL may generally not be a too nice return value...)
